snippet: The Open has already rewritten the books on attendance, with plans in the works to add as many as 10,000 more seats in coming years, organizers said.
abstract: United States Open tennis tournament is drawing record crowds, but fans are feeling the squeeze; there are plans to overhaul the tennis center to accommodate more fans.

byline.original: By MARY PILON and KEN BELSON

lead_paragraph: The Open has already rewritten the books on attendance, with plans in the works to add as many as 10,000 more seats in coming years, organizers said.

headline.seo: U.S. Open Is Drawing Record Crowds, but Fans Are Feeling the Squeeze
headline.main: U.S. Open Is Drawing Record Crowds, but Fans Are Feeling the Squeeze
headline.print_headline: Open Is Drawing Record Crowds, but Fans Are Feeling the Squeeze
